questions.question: Which is the first antibody class produced in response to an infection?
What is an epitope?
options: A part of an antigen that is recognized by antibodies or T cells
A protein that activates the immune system
A molecule produced by helper T cells
questions.answer: A part of an antigen that is recognized by antibodies or T cells

questions.question: What is the function of the Fc region of an antibody?
options: Bind to the complement system or immune cells
questions.answer: Bind to the complement system or immune cells

questions.question: What is the main characteristic of an antigen?
options: It is produced by the body
It is a type of antibody

questions.question: Which immunoglobulin is the most abundant in the blood and extracellular fluid?
Where are B cell receptors (BCRs) located?
options: On the surface of T cells
On the surface of B cells
On the surface of infected cells
questions.answer: On the surface of B cells

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true about IgA antibodies?
options: They are found primarily in the blood
They are involved in allergic reactions
They are found primarily in mucosal areas like the respiratory and digestive tracts
They are the first antibodies produced in an immune response
questions.answer: They are found primarily in mucosal areas like the respiratory and digestive tracts

questions.question: What is the function of memory B cells?
options: Produce antibodies during the first exposure to an antigen
Persist in the body to respond to future infections by the same pathogen
questions.answer: Persist in the body to respond to future infections by the same pathogen

questions.question: Which of the following molecules is involved in the activation of cytotoxic T cells?
What is the primary function of antibodies in neutralization?
options: Bind to toxins or pathogens and prevent them from interacting with host cells
questions.answer: Bind to toxins or pathogens and prevent them from interacting with host cells
